questionStatement: Consider the following statements regarding the Constituent Assembly of India: 1. It was set up under the Cabinet Mission Plan of 1946. 2. Dr. Rajendra Prasad was the permanent Chairman of the Constituent Assembly. 3. The Constitution was adopted on 26th November 1949. Which of the above statements is/are correct?
With reference to the 'Doctrine of Colourable Legislation', which of the following statements is most appropriate?

options.option1: Legislature can indirectly do what it cannot do directly
options.option2: Courts can review the wisdom of the legislature
options.option3: The executive cannot legislate on reserved subjects
options.option4: Parliament has unlimited power to amend the Constitution

questionStatement: Which of the following are correctly matched? 1. Article 17 – Abolition of untouchability 2. Article 23 – Prohibition of traffic in human beings 3. Article 24 – Right to education Select the correct answer:
The 'Montagu-Chelmsford Reforms' introduced which of the following?

Consider the following about the National Human Rights Commission (NHRC): 1. It is a statutory body established under the Protection of Human Rights Act, 1993. 2. Its Chairperson must be a retired Chief Justice of India. 3. It can award compensation to victims directly. Which of the above is/are correct?
With reference to the Westerlies, which of the following statements is correct?

options.option1: They blow from subtropical high pressure belts towards sub-polar low pressure belts
options.option2: They blow from polar high pressure areas towards sub-polar lows
options.option3: They are most pronounced in the Northern Hemisphere
options.option4: They are responsible for monsoon rainfall in India

questionStatement: Which of the following correctly describes 'Contour Bunding'?

options.option1: A technique to increase groundwater depletion
options.option2: A soil conservation measure that involves constructing embankments along contour lines
options.option4: A land reclamation process for waterlogged areas

questionStatement: Consider the following statements: 1. The Inter-State Council is a constitutional body under Article 263. 2. It was set up in 1990 on the recommendation of the Sarkaria Commission. 3. Its decisions are binding on the States. Which of the above is/are correct?
Which of the following Vedic texts is primarily a collection of philosophical dialogues in prose form?

Which of the following conditions are necessary for tropical cyclone formation? 1. Sea surface temperature above 26°C 2. Presence of a pre-existing disturbance 3. Low Coriolis force near the equator Select the correct answer:
The 'Pigovian Tax' is associated with which economic concept?

Consider the following about the Comptroller and Auditor General (CAG): 1. CAG audits the accounts of public sector undertakings only when the government equity exceeds 51%. 2. The CAG's reports are submitted to the President, not to Parliament directly. 3. CAG is the head of the Indian Audit and Accounts Department. Which is/are correct?
The Suez Canal connects which two water bodies?

Consider the following about India's Exclusive Economic Zone (EEZ): 1. It extends up to 200 nautical miles from the baseline. 2. India has full sovereignty over the EEZ including seabed, subsoil, and airspace. 3. Foreign vessels can exercise freedom of navigation in the EEZ. Which of the above is/are correct?
The 'Laffer Curve' in economics illustrates the relationship between:

With reference to the Rajya Sabha, which of the following statements is/are correct? 1. The Vice President of India is the ex-officio Chairman of Rajya Sabha. 2. Rajya Sabha members are elected for a term of six years. 3. One-third of Rajya Sabha members retire every two years. Select the correct answer:
Which of the following is the correct sequence of the battles that led to British supremacy in India?
The 'Hardinge Circular' of 1905 was related to:

Consider the following statements about the 'Preamble' of the Indian Constitution: 1. It is not enforceable by any court of law. 2. In the Berubari Union case, the Supreme Court held that the Preamble is a part of the Constitution. 3. The Preamble can be amended under Article 368. Which is/are correct?

Which of the following is correctly matched with its principal nutrient deficiency? 1. Kwashiorkor – Protein deficiency 2. Marasmus – Combined protein and calorie deficiency 3. Pellagra – Niacin (Vitamin B3) deficiency Select the correct answer:
Which of the following correctly describes 'Gig Economy'?

options.option1: An economy driven by agricultural exports
options.option2: A labour market characterized by short-term contracts and freelance work
options.option3: An economic model based on heavy industry
options.option4: A system in which workers are paid based on seniority

questionStatement: With reference to 'Particulate Matter (PM2.5)', which of the following statements is correct?

options.option1: PM2.5 refers to particles with diameter greater than 10 micrometres
options.option2: PM2.5 can penetrate deeper into lungs than PM10
options.option3: PM2.5 is not a regulated pollutant in India
options.option4: PM2.5 is mainly caused by volcanic eruptions only

questionStatement: Consider the following about the National Commission for Scheduled Tribes: 1. It is a constitutional body under Article 338A. 2. It was created by the 89th Constitutional Amendment Act, 2003. 3. Its Chairperson is always a member of a Scheduled Tribe. Which is/are correct?
The 'Tobin Tax' is a proposed tax on:
Which of the following rivers are tributaries of the Brahmaputra? 1. Subansiri 2. Manas 3. Teesta Select the correct answer:
With reference to India's Parliamentary system, which of the following best describes a 'Confidence Motion'?

options.option1: A motion moved by the Speaker to test the majority
options.option2: A motion moved by the government to test its majority on the floor of the House
options.option3: A motion moved by the Opposition to remove the Speaker
options.option4: A motion to impeach the President

questionStatement: Which of the following gases is responsible for the 'depletion of stratospheric ozone'? 1. Chlorofluorocarbons (CFCs) 2. Hydrochlorofluorocarbons (HCFCs) 3. Nitrous Oxide Select the correct answer:

Consider the following about the 'Panchsheel Agreement': 1. It was signed between India and China in 1954. 2. It was formally called the 'Agreement on Trade and Intercourse between Tibet Region of China and India'. 3. Non-interference in each other's internal affairs is one of its five principles. Which is/are correct?
Which of the following is not a function of the Lok Sabha Speaker?

options.option1: Presiding over joint sittings of Parliament
options.option2: Certifying a Bill as a Money Bill
options.option3: Deciding questions of disqualification of members under the 10th Schedule

questionStatement: Which soil type in India is known for its high moisture retentive capacity and is ideal for dryland farming?
The 'Phillips Curve' illustrates the trade-off between:

options.option3: Fiscal deficit and current account deficit

questionStatement: Consider the following about the TRIPS Agreement: 1. TRIPS stands for Trade-Related Aspects of Intellectual Property Rights. 2. It is administered by the World Bank. 3. It covers patents, copyrights, trademarks, and geographical indications. Which is/are correct?

Which of the following is the correct order of the Schedules dealing with these topics? 1. Oath and Affirmations – 3rd Schedule 2. Languages – 8th Schedule 3. Anti-Defection Law – 10th Schedule Select the correct answer:

Which of the following are features of 'Federalism with a strong Centre' in India? 1. Single Constitution for the Union and States 2. Integrated Judiciary 3. All-India Services Select the correct answer:
Which of the following describes 'Zero-based Budgeting'?

options.option1: Budget where all allocations start from the previous year's figures
options.option2: Budget where every expenditure must be justified from scratch each year
options.option3: Budget aiming at zero fiscal deficit
options.option4: Budget where taxes are reduced to zero for new industries

questionStatement: Consider the following: A satellite in a geostationary orbit has an orbital period equal to Earth's rotation period. Which of the following is true of this orbit? 1. It is located at an altitude of approximately 36,000 km above Earth. 2. Satellites in this orbit appear stationary to an observer on Earth. 3. It is possible for a geostationary satellite to orbit over the poles. Select the correct answer:
The term 'IBSA Dialogue Forum' refers to a trilateral grouping of:

options.option2: India, Bangladesh, Sri Lanka and Afghanistan

questionStatement: Which of the following is/are correctly described about 'Biodiversity Hotspots'? 1. They must contain at least 1,500 species of endemic vascular plants. 2. They must have lost at least 70% of their original habitat. 3. India has four recognized biodiversity hotspots. Select the correct answer:
Which of the following correctly describes the term 'Capital Account Convertibility'?

options.option1: Freedom to convert domestic currency to foreign currency for current account transactions
options.option2: Freedom to convert domestic currency for capital transactions like investment and borrowings
options.option3: Conversion of government bonds into equity shares
options.option4: A mechanism to convert tax liability into capital assets

questionStatement: The 'Champaran Agrarian Bill' of 1917 in British India was primarily aimed at:

options.option2: Abolishing the Tinkathia system that forced farmers to grow indigo
options.option3: Granting land ownership rights to peasants
options.option4: Fixing maximum rental rates for agricultural land

questionStatement: Which of the following correctly describe the concept of 'Inclusive Growth' as understood in India's planning?

options.option1: Growth that benefits only urban areas
options.option2: Growth that is broad-based across sectors and provides equal opportunity to all
options.option3: Growth exclusively driven by the private sector
options.option4: Growth measured only by rise in per capita income

questionStatement: Consider the following about the 'Arctic Council': 1. It is an intergovernmental forum for Arctic nations and indigenous peoples. 2. India is a permanent member of the Arctic Council. 3. It was established by the Ottawa Declaration in 1996. Which is/are correct?

With reference to the Indian Ocean Dipole (IOD), which of the following is/are correct? 1. A positive IOD is associated with above-normal rainfall in India. 2. IOD is influenced by the differential warming of the western and eastern tropical Indian Ocean. 3. IOD has no connection to El Niño. Select the correct answer:
The 'Palani Hills' in Tamil Nadu belong to which hill range?

Consider the following about India's Nuclear Doctrine: 1. India follows a 'No First Use' policy. 2. India will not use nuclear weapons against non-nuclear states. 3. Nuclear retaliation would be massive, aimed at causing unacceptable damage. Which is/are correct?

Which of the following is the correct matching of Committees with their functions? 1. Public Accounts Committee – examines appropriation of funds granted by Parliament 2. Estimates Committee – examines economy, organization, and efficiency of ministries 3. Committee on Public Undertakings – examines working of public sector enterprises Select the correct answer:
Which of the following describes 'Nutrient Cycling' in an ecosystem?

options.option1: The one-way flow of energy through trophic levels
options.option2: The circulation of nutrients from the environment through living organisms and back to the environment
options.option3: The process of primary production by autotrophs
options.option4: The conversion of solar energy into biomass

questionStatement: The concept of 'Parliamentary Sovereignty' is most closely associated with which country's constitution?

Consider the following about 'Special Drawing Rights (SDRs)': 1. SDRs are issued by the International Monetary Fund. 2. SDRs can be used as a direct medium of exchange in international trade. 3. The value of SDR is based on a basket of five currencies including Chinese Renminbi. Which is/are correct?

Which of the following are correctly matched? 1. Mission Shakti – anti-satellite missile test 2. NAVIC – regional navigation satellite system 3. RISAT – radar imaging satellite Select the correct answer:
A sum of money doubles itself in 10 years at simple interest. In how many years will it become four times?
Read the following passage and answer: 'All doctors are intelligent. Some intelligent people are artists. Therefore ____.' Which conclusion necessarily follows?

options.option3: No conclusion about doctors and artists can be drawn

questionStatement: A man walks 5 km north, turns right and walks 3 km, then turns right again and walks 5 km. How far is he from his starting point?
In a class of 40 students, 60% passed in Mathematics and 70% passed in English. If 20% failed in both subjects, how many students passed in both?
Find the odd one out from the series: 2, 5, 10, 17, 26, 37, 50, 64
A and B together can complete a work in 12 days. B and C together can complete it in 15 days. A and C together can complete it in 20 days. In how many days can all three together complete the work?
A shopkeeper marks an article 40% above cost price and gives a discount of 20%. What is the profit percentage?
If ROME is coded as VSQI, how is LION coded?
Two trains of equal length running in opposite directions cross each other in 20 seconds. If one train is running at 60 km/h and the other at 40 km/h, what is the length of each train?

A cistern has a leak which would empty it in 8 hours. A tap is turned on which fills 6 litres a minute into the cistern. If the cistern is now emptied in 12 hours, what is the capacity of the cistern?

Which of the following about 'Pradhan Mantri Jan Dhan Yojana (PMJDY)' is correct? 1. It was launched in 2014 with a focus on financial inclusion. 2. The scheme provides overdraft facility to account holders. 3. It provides life insurance of Rs. 2 lakh under PM Jeevan Jyoti Bima Yojana linked to PMJDY. Select the correct answer:

With reference to the 'Himalayan Rivers', which of the following is correct? 1. The Indus, Ganga, and Brahmaputra are antecedent rivers. 2. Antecedent rivers are older than the mountains they flow through. 3. The Himalayan rivers carry less sediment compared to Peninsular rivers. Select the correct answer:
Which of the following is NOT a constitutional provision for the protection of civil servants in India?

options.option1: Article 310 – Tenure of office of civil servants
options.option2: Article 311 – Dismissal, removal or reduction in rank

questionStatement: Consider the following about the 'Convention on Biological Diversity (CBD)': 1. It was opened for signature at the Earth Summit in Rio de Janeiro in 1992. 2. Its three objectives are conservation of biodiversity, sustainable use, and fair sharing of benefits. 3. The Nagoya Protocol is a supplementary agreement to CBD. Which is/are correct?
The 'Bhopal Declaration' is associated with which of the following?

Which of the following correctly explains 'Stagflation'? 1. It occurs when inflation is high and economic growth is stagnant. 2. Traditional monetary policy tools are less effective in controlling it. 3. It was first observed during the oil crisis of the 1970s. Select the correct answer:

Consider the following about India's approach to 'Cooperative Federalism': 1. NITI Aayog replaced the Planning Commission as a vehicle for cooperative federalism. 2. The GST Council is a constitutional body that embodies cooperative federalism. 3. The Inter-State Council is chaired by the Chief Justice of India. Which is/are correct?
Which of the following correctly describes the 'Inverse Relationship' between bond prices and interest rates?

options.option1: When interest rates rise, existing bond prices fall because new bonds offer higher returns
options.option2: When interest rates rise, bond prices also rise to attract investors
options.option3: Bond prices and interest rates move in the same direction always
options.option4: Interest rates have no impact on bond market prices

questionStatement: Consider the following statements about 'El Niño': 1. El Niño is characterized by unusual warming of sea surface temperatures in the central and eastern tropical Pacific Ocean. 2. El Niño years are generally associated with below-normal monsoon rainfall in India. 3. El Niño occurs every year. Which is/are correct?

Which of the following is/are objectives of the 'National Action Plan on Climate Change (NAPCC)'? 1. National Solar Mission 2. National Mission for a Green India 3. National Mission for Enhanced Energy Efficiency Select the correct answer:

Consider the following statements about 'Habeas Corpus': 1. It is a writ issued to produce a person detained illegally before a court. 2. It can be suspended only during a National Emergency under Article 359. 3. It can be issued against both government and private individuals. Which is/are correct?
Which of the following ports in India are classified as 'Major Ports' under the Major Port Trusts Act? 1. Kandla 2. Paradip 3. Mundra Select the correct answer:

With reference to 'Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana (PMFBY)', which of the following is correct? 1. The premium for Kharif crops is capped at 2% for farmers. 2. The scheme covers post-harvest losses due to cyclones and unseasonal rains. 3. Loanee farmers are mandatorily covered under the scheme. Select the correct answer:
The 'Sakala' initiative, often seen in the news, is related to:

options.option1: A scheme for skill development of tribal youth
options.option2: A time-bound delivery of government services in Karnataka
options.option3: A PM-led initiative for eastern State development
options.option4: An agricultural reform program for dryland farmers

questionStatement: Consider the following about 'Quantum Computing': 1. Quantum computers use quantum bits (qubits) that can exist in superposition. 2. Quantum computing can break current RSA encryption standards. 3. India has launched a National Quantum Mission to develop quantum technology. Which is/are correct?
